item.title: Report E-2024020086
item.description:
Report E-2024020086

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, one (!) 5-gallon drum of UN1263 was damaged in transit due to unprotected freight and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the sealant-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents as well as the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010738
item.description:
Report X-2024010738

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: OOLTEWAH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to internal leakage from bottle within package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2024010739
item.description:
Report X-2024010739

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: OOLTEWAH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: An inbound sticker on the bottom of the box suggests that the box was turned upside down contrary to the orientation arrows. Action taken is unknown. DescribePack: The threads of the cap were crossed causing a faulty seal and leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in an open contents bins and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024010709
item.description:
Report X-2024010709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered damaged and leaking in the Memphis Hub during sort operations. The steel drum was punctured near the bottom chime. The drum was placed into a steel salvage package and held pending disposition from the shipper.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED DURING SORTATION. CONTAINER PLACED INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR EVALUATION DescribePack: CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH CAUSED INTERNAL LEAKAGE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: TURN UPRIGHT AND CAPS TIGHTENED
